Articles.Content: Suddenly (and I mean suddenly) the X key (engine cutoff) now also functions as / (disable timewarp), so every time I press X, the timewarp also cuts. It's pretty darn frustrating, and I have literally no info, other than it started last week in the middle of a KSP session and has persisted since. Is this a known bug, and what should I do to troubleshoot this issue?
Kerbal Alarm Clock has a setting called "Halt timewarp when throttle cutoff by keystroke". Perhaps this is the problem.

On 8/7/2018 at 9:12 AM, mystifeid said:

Kerbal Alarm Clock has a setting called "Halt timewarp when throttle cutoff by keystroke". Perhaps this is the problem.

Ah-HA, that was the cause. Much appreciation.
